tool.name: tablerow
tool.shortdescription: Allows access to rows of a table tool
tool.description: A table row is a record containing the values of a single row for all or optionally just specified columns from a table. In constructing the tablerow tool, one can specify which columns are to be included or excluded. Tool functions then allow getting and putting of table rows.

method.name: set
method.shortdescription: Set table and columns to be accessed
method.description: Reset the \texttt{tablerow} tool to use the given table and columns.

param.name: tab
param.description: table to be accessed, expects a table tool

param.name: exclude
param.description: Exclude instead of include the named columns?

method.name: get
method.description: Get the values in the given row. The values are returned as a record where the field names are the column names. Note that rows are numbered starting at 1.

method.name: put
method.description:
Put the values in the given record into the given table row. By default only the fields will be put with a name matching a column name in the \texttt{tablerow} tool. However, if \texttt{matchingfields=F} the given record must exactly match the tablerow layout (i.e. the column names in it). This is faster and can be used to put a record acquired using the /texttt{get} function.
Note that rows are numbered starting at 1.

param.name: matchingfields
param.description: F=value record must match tablerow layout

method.name: close
method.description: Close the tablerow. It can thereafter be reused using the set function.

method.name: done
method.description: Close the \texttt{tablerow} tool and free up all memory.
